problem.p: Why did you choose this answer?

choicegroup.choice: At this point, atmospheric drag will have slowed the missile down.
The acceleration from Earth's gravity will be the smallest here, so the rocket's speed will also be the smallest.
Kepler's Second Law indicates that the missile's speed will be smallest here.
Newton's Third Law says that the missile and Earth put the same force on each other, which is smallest here.
Kepler's Third Law relates the time the missile takes to its distance from Earth. The farther up the missile is along its path, the more time it takes.
At this distance gravity from the Moon will also be pulling on the missile, slowing it down.
